subject: Business
title: Creative Destruction: Schumpeter's Insight
description: A short lesson to help you apply Creative Destruction: Schumpeter's Insight.

hook.text: Blockbuster had 9,000 stores in 2004. By 2010, it was bankrupt. Netflix didn't just compete â€” it destroyed the category.

buildup.text: Joseph Schumpeter called it 'creative destruction': innovation destroys old industries while creating new ones.

discovery.text: It's the engine of capitalism. Horse carriages gave way to cars. Typewriters gave way to computers.

twist.text: Creative destruction is painful. Real people lose real jobs. But blocking it means stagnation for everyone.

climax.text: The average lifespan of an S&P 500 company fell from 61 years in 1958 to 18 years today. Destruction is accelerating.

punchline.text: Destroy or be destroyed. That's not a threat â€” it's economics.
